Welcome to rpncalc’s documentation!¶

rpn io¶

This file is executed first when the rpncalc application is run by the user.
USAGE:

Interactive:

rpncalc Launch in interactive mode

example:

rpncalc
> 1 2 +
3 > 5 +
8 > quit

One Time Use:

rpncalc [expression]

To evaluate a one-line expression
One can also excute several expressions in a pipeline
by using the ‘,’ operator to seperate them.

examples:

rpncalc 1 2 +
3

rpncalc 1 2 +, 5 +
8


NOTE: The expression should be supplied in the form of a string to the rpncalc.

rpn config¶

This file stores the value of global variables and sets the variables using a rc file (‘.rpnrc’) if it is present in your home directory.

rpn custom_errors¶

My very own execption class made just for this rpn calculator. This file converts exceptions objects into beautiful strings using __str__

class rpn.custom_errors.ConversionToBase10(msg, typ)¶

Handles my very own made error for the app, when the output can’t be converted to base 10.

class rpn.custom_errors.Infinite(name, msg)¶

Handles my very own made error for the app, when the output is infinite. The calculations with infinity along with limits is not avialable in this version.

class rpn.custom_errors.OneWordCommand(name)¶

Handles my very own made error for the app, when we supply other commands to one command functions.

class rpn.custom_errors.Overflow(name, msg)¶

Handles the math Overflow Exception, when the output overflows.

class rpn.custom_errors.Type(name, msg, typ)¶

Handles the Type Exceptions.

class rpn.custom_errors.Value(name, msg)¶

Handles the Value Exceptions.

class rpn.custom_errors.ZeroDivision(name, msg)¶

This class handles Zero Division Error and returns relavent error string.

class rpn.custom_errors.ZeroRaisedToZero(name, msg)¶

Handles my very own made error for the app, 0 raised to power of 0.

rpn calc¶

This file contains the code for parser and the different functionalities present in the calculator. The flow of the application is from calc.py to io.py

rpn.calc.change_ans_by_mode(an) → str¶

Changes the answer to the required mode set by the user.

Parameters

an (str) – It is the answer of the rpn calculations after

Returns

returns the answer in the correct mode.

Return type

str

rpn.calc.check_macro(arr3) → bool¶

Checks if there is a macro name in the list made from user input string and stores it, if there is no other variable already using that name. If an already user declared macro was re-declared by the user again then it will overwrite that macro.

Parameters

arr3 (list) – this list is the user input string in list form.

Returns

if there was a ‘macro’, string in the list it returns True else False.

Return type

bool

rpn.calc.check_mode(arr) → bool¶

checks the mode of the rpncalc that the user wants. Modes in rpncalc - decimal, binary, ocatal, hexadecimal, radians and degrees.

Parameters

arr (list) – an array with all the commands passed by the user as input string.

Returns

returns true if the string contains a mode changing command

else return false.

Return type

bool

rpn.calc.clear_commands(arr) → bool¶

Checks whether the user string contains clear commands. It is also responsible for executing those commands

Parameters

arr (list) – the user string after removing extraspaces in the form of list

Returns

returns True if there was a clear command, else returns False

Return type

bool

rpn.calc.count_more_operands_needed(a) → int¶

Takes the string and finds out the number of operands needed, based on the number of binary operators and unary operators.

Parameters

a (str) – a is the string supplied by the user

Returns

the number of operands that need to be taken from the stack

Return type

int

rpn.calc.interactive_use()¶

This function is called when user wants to calculate rpn expressions interactively. The program quits if the user types ‘quit’ or creates an EOF error.

rpn.calc.make_str(stac) → str¶

Given an arry it removes the extra spaces and forms a string.

Parameters

stac (list) – stac is the name of the array.

Returns

res is the resulting string of the array.

Return type

str

rpn.calc.my_help(name_of_function)¶

My own help functionality to help user, about the functionalities present in the calculator.

Parameters

name_of_function (str) – name of the function or operator.

rpn.calc.one_time_use(s)¶

This function gets called if the user wants to use the rpncalc for one time use. User can parse just one ron expression or parse many expressions in a pipeline seperated by commas ‘,’.

Parameters

s (str) – string given by user from the args in command line.

Returns

returns the answer to the user.

Return type

str

rpn.calc.print_dic(dic)¶

Prints the dictionary.

Parameters

dic (dict) – [takes a dictionary type data as input]

rpn.calc.rand_func(arr2) → list¶

Find and assignes a random value of rand variable in the user input string. the random value assigned is always in between the range of 0 and 1.

Parameters

arr2 (list) – takes input as list made from the user input string.

Returns

returns a list after replacing rand with a random value between 0 and 1.

Return type

list

rpn.calc.repeat_func(arr, stac, parallel)¶

repeat function is used to repeat an operator given number of times.

Parameters

  • arr (list) – the array of the input string given by user.

  • stac (list) – the stack present in the calculator.

  • parallel (int) – 0 means not parallel execution, 1 means parallel execution.

Returns

a tuple of string, stack and int flag for the successful

execution of the repeat function.

Return type

tuple

rpn.calc.stack_manipulation(arr, stac)¶

Performes all the stack manipulation functions on the user supplied string. This function is also responsible for filling the rand variable in string.

Parameters

  • arr (list) – [arr is the list made from the user string]

  • stac (list) – [stac is the calculator’s stack of type list]

Returns

returns a tuple of (str, list, int). String is the new user string, list is the new stack and integer can take two values 0 or 1

Return type

tuple

rpn.calc.stack_properties(arr) → bool¶

These one word command tels about the properties of stack. ‘stack’ command changes the display of stack from horizontal to vertical and vice-versa. ‘depth’ command pushes the length of the stack in the stack.

Parameters

arr (list) – the user string after removing extraspaces in the form of list

Returns

True if there was a stack property command or else False.

Return type

bool

rpn.calc.stack_value(i) → str¶

Converts the supplied input into a base 10 representation of the number in the string form.

Parameters

can be of any type, int , float, string or decimal type. (i) –

Returns

string which is the base 10 repesentation of ‘i’

Return type

str

rpn lexer¶

This file is responnsible for the lexer used by this rpn calculator.

class rpn.lexer.RPNlexer¶

This class has all the tokens that are to be classified by this rpn calculator.
